page.title: 07Wethersfield Riding Stables
page.content: The stables are one of the few recreation facilities in our square. The stables consist of 8 acres of land with 12 horses (9 mares,3 geldings) and one employed person apart from the owner. The owner has had the stables for 4 years and when she wishes to obtain horses she buys, but does not breed them. In the winter it costs Â£10 a week to keep a horse of 15 hands. The horses eat bran, barley, oats, sugarbeet and hay, and in summer they eat grass as additionial foodstuff. The owner trained as an instructor and then passed an exam to go into partnership with the previous owner of the stables. Although the business is not profitable, it survives and the daughter of the owner will inherit it unless it is sold.
